wiki_links.title: LuckPerms Wiki
wiki_links.description: Learn how to use LuckPerms and all of its features by reading the wiki on GitHub.

wiki_links.title: Installing LuckPerms
wiki_links.description: You can install LuckPerms on Spigot/Paper, Sponge, BungeeCord/Waterfall, Velocity and others. Check the installation guide for more info on setting up LuckPerms.

wiki_links.title: Network Installation
wiki_links.description: If you run a Bungeecord network, learn how to correctly setup LuckPerms on all server instances (including Bungee).

wiki_links.title: Syncing data between servers
wiki_links.description: To sync data between servers, you need to connect each LuckPerms plugin to the same database (for example MySQL) and set up a messaging service.

wiki_links.title: Usage
wiki_links.description: Here's a guide to help users understand and use LuckPerms for the first time.

wiki_links.title: Storage system errors
wiki_links.description: Here's a page with some common storage system errors.

wiki_links.title: Web Editor
wiki_links.description: LuckPerms offers an easy to use, powerful Web Editor, with which you can add, delete and change permissions of groups and players.

wiki_links.title: Verbose
wiki_links.description: LuckPerms provides a `verbose` command to help you find out what permissions a command/plugin is checking.

wiki_links.title: Prefixes, Suffixes & Meta
wiki_links.description: You can set prefixes, suffixes and other meta data in LuckPerms for players and groups. Note that LuckPerms does **not** manage chat. You need to use another plugin to show prefixes/suffixes in chat.

wiki_links.title: Context
wiki_links.description: You can set a permission or group on a per-world/per-server basis, through what we call "contexts".

wiki_links.title: Default Groups
wiki_links.description: LuckPerms provides a group that every player is added to upon joining the server, called `default`. You can use multiple methods to change the default group or change the name of it.

wiki_links.title: Storage types
wiki_links.description: LuckPerms allows you to store data in a variety of storage types, read about the benefits and drawbacks of each type on the wiki.

wiki_links.title: Command Usage
wiki_links.description: Find all of the available LuckPerms commands on the wiki.

wiki_links.title: FAQ
wiki_links.description: Check out some of our frequently asked questions.

wiki_links.title: Migration
wiki_links.description: Learn about the process of migrating from another permission plugin.

wiki_links.title: Bulk Editing
wiki_links.description: Quickly update a large amount of user and group permissions by using the `bulkupdate` command.

wiki_links.title: Switching storage types
wiki_links.description: If you wish to change your storage type (e.g. to YAML or MySQL) you may need to follow these instructions to ensure your groups and permissions are migrated to the new storage type.

wiki_links.title: Prefix & Suffix Stacking
wiki_links.description: Display multiple prefixes/suffixes alongside a player's name.

wiki_links.title: Tracks
wiki_links.description: Tracks provide a method for you to promote/demote players along a track (or ladder) of groups.

wiki_links.title: Advanced Setup
wiki_links.description: Discover some of the more advanced concepts of LuckPerms, such as permission calculation, shorthand permissions and more.

wiki_links.title: Argument based command permissions
wiki_links.description: Fine tune exactly what users with permission to use LuckPerms can do.

wiki_links.title: Developer API
wiki_links.description: Learn how to use the LuckPerms API in your project.

wiki_links.title: Placeholders
wiki_links.description: Display data such as user prefixes and groups from LuckPerms in other plugins.

wiki_links.title: Permissions
wiki_links.description: A list of permissions used by LuckPerms commands.

wiki_links.title: Downloads
wiki_links.description: You cab download LuckPerms for Spigot/Paper, BungeeCord, Sponge, Nukkit or Velocity.
